title: Instructional Design Process for Enhancing Academic Activity Awareness and Academic Performance

context.prior_knowledge: Basic social studies knowledge at the university level
context.additional_context: Requires a practical approach to analyze the relationship between academic activities and performance based on office/administrative work experience as a working professional

learning_goals: Cultivation of the ability to design educational programs by applying the five IMESA (Instructional Situation Analysis) principles: intentional, design-oriented, relational, evaluative, and learning-focused
Development of project-based competency to analyze correlations between academic activity awareness and grade impact
Fostering the ability to establish strategies that reduce perception gaps between instructors and learners in blended learning environments
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
